title: 107_hr638
content: The Act titled "Domestic Partnership Benefits and Obligations Act of 2001" provides benefits to domestic partners of federal employees. The "Domestic Partnership Benefits and Obligations Act of 2001" grants benefits to domestic partners of federal employees, who must file an affidavit of eligibility certifying their relationship and shared responsibilities. The "Domestic Partnership Benefits and Obligations Act of 2001" requires federal employees and their domestic partners to file an affidavit of eligibility, understand the consequences of falsifying information, and dissolve the partnership within 30 days if necessary. The "Domestic Partnership Benefits and Obligations Act of 2001" mandates that benefits terminate if a domestic partnership dissolves by means other than death, with the domestic partner being treated as a spouse in case of the employee's death. The "Domestic Partnership Benefits and Obligations Act of 2001" states that if a partnership dissolves by means other than death, health benefits for the domestic partner will continue for 60 days. Information submitted for benefits eligibility must be kept confidential. The term "domestic partner" refers to an adult person in a committed relationship with another adult person, not married. Benefits include retirement, life insurance, health insurance, and compensation for work injuries under specific US Code chapters. In the United States Code, the term "employee" is defined differently for Civil Service Retirement, Federal Employees' Retirement, life insurance, and health insurance. The term "employee" is defined in section 8101(1) of title 5, United States Code for compensation for work injuries. The term "obligations" refer to duties or responsibilities of an employee's spouse. SEC. 3. EXEMPTION FROM TAX FOR EMPLOYER-PROVIDED FRINGE BENEFITS TO DOMESTIC PARTNERS. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows the provisions of the Domestic Partnership Benefits and Obligations Act of 2001 to apply to employees and their domestic partners for certain benefits.
